        <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Investissements de capital-risque (statistiques de marché)</common:Name>
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Venture capital investments (market statistics)</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Dans la Base de donn&eacute;es de l&rsquo;OCDE sur le financement de l&rsquo;entrepreneuriat, le capital risque correspond &agrave; la somme du capital risque investi au stade de d&eacute;veloppement initial (qui comprend le pr&eacute;amor&ccedil;age, l&rsquo;amor&ccedil;age, le d&eacute;marrage et les autres stades de d&eacute;veloppement initial) et au stade de d&eacute;veloppement ult&eacute;rieur. Comme les diverses associations d&rsquo;investisseurs de capital risque et autres fournisseurs de donn&eacute;es n&rsquo;utilisent pas de d&eacute;finition harmonis&eacute;e des stades d&rsquo;investissement du capital risque, les donn&eacute;es d&rsquo;origine ont &eacute;t&eacute; agr&eacute;g&eacute;es &agrave; nouveau de mani&egrave;re &agrave; correspondre &agrave; la classification du capital risque par stades de d&eacute;veloppement de l&rsquo;OCDE. L&rsquo;Afrique du Sud, la Cor&eacute;e, la F&eacute;d&eacute;ration de Russie et la Nouvelle Z&eacute;lande ne fournissent pas de ventilations du capital risque par stade de d&eacute;veloppement qui permettraient de r&eacute;aliser des comparaisons internationales valables.</p><p>Le tableau ci-joint pr&eacute;sente les correspondances entre les donn&eacute;es d&rsquo;origine et les donn&eacute;es harmonis&eacute;es par l&rsquo;OCDE de la ventilation du capital risque par stade de d&eacute;veloppement.</p><p><a href="https://stats.oecd.org/wbos/fileview2.aspx?IDFile=2aa27890-769e-4f10-843a-a654c5e7b24e">https://stats.oecd.org/wbos/fileview2.aspx?IDFile=2aa27890-769e-4f10-843a-a654c5e7b24e</a></p><p>Le capital risque est une forme de capital investissement particuli&egrave;rement importante pour les jeunes entreprises pr&eacute;sentant un potentiel d&rsquo;innovation et de croissance, mais dont le mod&egrave;le &eacute;conomique n&rsquo;a pas encore fait ses preuves et qui n&rsquo;ont pas d&rsquo;historique d&rsquo;activit&eacute; ; il remplace ou compl&egrave;te les financements bancaires classiques. Le d&eacute;veloppement de cette forme de financement est consid&eacute;r&eacute; comme une condition cadre importante pour stimuler l&rsquo;entrepreneuriat innovant. Les donn&eacute;es agr&eacute;g&eacute;es sur le capital-risque fournissent des informations utiles sur l'&eacute;volution du secteur du capital-risque.</p><p>Ces donn&eacute;es sont g&eacute;n&eacute;ralement compil&eacute;es par des associations nationales et r&eacute;gionales de capital-investissement et de capital-risque, souvent avec le concours de fournisseurs de donn&eacute;es sur les entreprises. La qualit&eacute; et la disponibilit&eacute; de donn&eacute;es agr&eacute;g&eacute;es sur le capital-risque se sont consid&eacute;rablement am&eacute;lior&eacute;es ces derni&egrave;res ann&eacute;es ; il demeure difficile, cependant, de r&eacute;aliser des comparaisons internationales du fait de deux probl&egrave;mes principaux.</p><p>La premi&egrave;re difficult&eacute; tient &agrave; l&rsquo;absence de d&eacute;finition internationale normalis&eacute;e du capital-risque. Si tout le monde comprend de quoi il s&rsquo;agit, la d&eacute;finition des types d&rsquo;investissements inclus dans le capital-risque varie d&rsquo;un pays et d&rsquo;une r&eacute;gion &agrave; l&rsquo;autre. Dans certains cas, les diff&eacute;rences sont purement linguistiques ; dans d&rsquo;autres, elles sont plus profondes.</p><p>Le second probl&egrave;me a trait &agrave; la diversit&eacute; des m&eacute;thodes employ&eacute;es par ceux qui compilent les donn&eacute;es. C&rsquo;est la mani&egrave;re dont les donn&eacute;es sont collect&eacute;es qui d&eacute;termine si les statistiques sur le capital-risque donneront une image compl&egrave;te et repr&eacute;sentative de ce secteur dans un pays donn&eacute;.</p><p>Les unit&eacute;s utilis&eacute;es sont :<br />Millions de dollars des E-U; part du PIB.</p><p>Contact pour les statistiques de l'OCDE : <a href="mailto:stat.contact@oecd.org">stat.contact@oecd.org</a></common:Description>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">In the OECD Entrepreneurship Financing Database, venture capital is made up of the sum of early stage (including pre-seed, seed, start-up and other early stage) and later stage venture capital. As there are no harmonised definitions of venture capital stages across venture capital associations and other data providers, original data have been re-aggregated to fit the OECD classification of venture capital by stages. Korea, New Zealand, the Russian Federation and South Africa do not provide breakdowns of venture capital by stage that would allow meaningful international comparisons.</p><p>The attached table shows the correspondences between original data and OECD harmonised data for venture capital investments by stage.</p><p><a href="https://stats.oecd.org/wbos/fileview2.aspx?IDFile=2aa27890-769e-4f10-843a-a654c5e7b24e">https://stats.oecd.org/wbos/fileview2.aspx?IDFile=2aa27890-769e-4f10-843a-a654c5e7b24e</a></p><p>Venture capital is a form of equity financing particularly relevant for young companies with innovation and growth potential but untested business models and no track record; it replaces or complements traditional bank finance. The development of the venture capital industry is considered an important framework condition to stimulate innovative entrepreneurship. Aggregate data on venture capital provide useful information on trends in the venture capital industry.</p><p>These data are typically compiled by national or regional Private Equity and Venture Capital Associations, often with the support of commercial data providers. The quality and availability of aggregate data on venture capital have improved considerably in recent years; international comparisons, however, remain complicated because of two main problems.</p><p>The first difficulty comes from the lack of a standard international definition of venture capital. While there is a general understanding, the definition of the types of investments included in venture capital varies across countries and regions. In some cases, differences are purely linguistic; in others, they are more substantive. The second problem relates to the diverse methodologies employed by data compilers. The completeness and representativeness of venture capital statistics with respect to the venture capital industry of a country will differ depending on how data were collected.</p><p>The units used are : Millions of US Dollars and share of GDP.</p><p>OECD statistics contact: <a href="mailto:stat.contact@oecd.org">stat.contact@oecd.org</a></common:Description>

      <structure:Codelist isPartial="true" id="CL_FREQ" agencyID="SDMX" version="2.1" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Code list for concept "Frequency"</common:Name>
        <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Codelist pour le concept "Fréquence"</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code list provides a set of values indicating
					the "frequency" of the data (e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly). The concept
					"frequency" may refer to various stages in the production process, e.g. data
					collection or data dissemination. For example, a time series could be
					disseminated at annual frequency but the underlying data are compiled monthly.
					The code list is applicable for all different uses of
					"frequency".</common:Description>
        <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Cette liste de codes fournit un ensemble de valeurs
					indiquant la "fréquence" des données (par exemple, hebdomadaire, mensuelle,
					trimestrielle). Le concept de "fréquence" peut faire référence à différentes
					étapes du processus de production, par ex. collecte ou diffusion de données. Par
					exemple, une série chronologique pourrait être diffusée à une fréquence
					annuelle, mais les données sous-jacentes sont compilées mensuellement. La liste
					de codes est applicable pour toutes les différentes utilisations de
					"fréquence".</common:Description>
        <structure:Code id="A">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Annual</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Annuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every year</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
      <structure:Codelist id="CL_OBS_STATUS" agencyID="SDMX" version="2.2" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation Status</common:Name>
        <structure:Code id="A">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Normal value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used as default value if no value is provided or when no special coded qualification is assumed. Usually, it can be assumed that the source agency assigns sufficient confidence to the provided observation and/or the value is not expected to be dramatically revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="B">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Time series break</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observations are characterised as such when different content exists or a different methodology has been applied to this observation as compared with the preceding one (the one given for the previous period).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Definition differs</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate slight deviations from the established methodology (footnote-type information); these divergences do not imply a break in time series.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="E">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Estimated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation obtained through an estimation methodology (e.g. to produce back-casts) or based on the use of a limited amount of data or ad hoc sampling and through additional calculations (e.g. to produce a value at an early stage of the production stage while not all data are available). It may also be used in case of experimental data (e.g. in the context of a pilot ahead of a full scale production process) or in case of data of (anticipated/assessed) low quality. If needed, additional information can be provided through free text using the COMMENT_OBS attribute at the observation level or at a higher level. This code is to be used when the estimation is done by a sender agency. When the imputation is carried out by a receiver agency in order to replace or fill gaps in reported data series, the flag to use is I "Value imputed by a receiving agency".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="F">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Forecast value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Value deemed to assess the magnitude which a quantity will assume at some future point of time (as distinct from "estimated value" which attempts to assess the magnitude of an already existent quantity).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="G">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Experimental value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Data collected on the basis of definitions or (alternative) collection methods under development. Data not of guaranteed quality as normally expected from provider.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="I">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Value imputed by a receiving agency</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation imputed by a receiving agency to replace or fill gaps in reported data series. This code is intended to cover all cases where a receiving agency publishes data about a sending agency that do not come from an official source in the sender agency's reporting framework. When the estimation is done by the sender agency, the flag to use is E "Estimated value".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="K">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Data included in another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data for a given category are missing and are included in another category, sub-total or total. Generally where code "K" is used there should be a corresponding code "W - Includes data from another category" assigned to the over-covered category. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify under which category the data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Includes data from another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data include another category, or go beyond the scope of the data collection and are therefore over-covered. Generally, where code "W" is used there should be a corresponding code "K - Data included in another category" assigned to the category which is under-covered. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify which additional data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="O">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is to be used when no breakdown is made between the reasons why data are missing. Data can be missing due to many reasons: data cannot exist, data exist but are not collected (e.g. because they are below a certain threshold or subject to a derogation clause), data are unreliable, etc.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data cannot exist</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to denote empty cells resulting from the impossibility to collect a statistical value (e.g. a particular education level or type of institution may be not applicable to a given country's education system).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Provisional value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">An observation is characterised as "provisional" when the source agency - while it bases its calculations on its standard production methodology - considers that the data, almost certainly, are expected to be revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Strike and other special events</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Special circumstances (e.g. strike) affecting the observation or causing a missing value.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="L">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data exist but were not collected</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when some data are not reported/disseminated because they are below a certain threshold.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; holiday or weekend</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used in some daily data flows.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; suppressed</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when data are suppressed due to statistical confidentiality considerations.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="J">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Derogation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Clause in an agreement (e.g. legal act, gentlemen's agreement) stating that some provisions in the agreement are not to be implemented by designated parties; these derogations may affect the observation or cause a missing value. In general, derogations are limited in time.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="N">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not significant</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate a value which is not a "real" zero (e.g. a result of 0.0004 rounded to zero).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="U">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Low reliability</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This indicates existing observations, but for which the user should also be aware of the low quality assigned.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="V">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unvalidated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation as received from the respondent without further evaluation of data quality.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
      <structure:Codelist isPartial="true" id="CL_UNIT_MULT" agencyID="SDMX" version="1.2" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit Multiplier</common:Name>
        <structure:Code id="0">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Units</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of zero (10^0)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="6">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Millions</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">In scientific notation, expressed as ten raised to the power of six (10^6)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>

          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Période ou point dans le temps auquel l'observation se réfère effectivement.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="OBS_VALUE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation value</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Valeur d'observation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Value of a particular variable.</common:Description>

        </structure:Concept>

        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="UNIT_MULT">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit multiplier</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Multiplicateur d'unité</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Exponent in base 10 specified so that multiplying the observation numeric values by 10^UNIT_MULT gives a value expressed in the unit of measure.</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Exposant en base 10 spécifié pour que la multiplication des valeurs numériques d'observation par 10^UNIT_MULT donne une valeur exprimée dans l'unité de mesure.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="UNIT_MEASURE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit of measure</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Unité de mesure</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Unit in which the data values are expressed.</common:Description>
          <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Unité dans laquelle les valeurs des données sont exprimées.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="CURRENCY">

          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Monnaie</common:Name>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="DECIMALS">
